@graph.name: How to Add Products to Shopify Collections
@graph.description: Step-by-step guide for adding products to Shopify collections using both manual and automated methods.

step.name: Access Collections in Shopify Admin
step.text: From your Shopify Admin, go to Products > Collections.

step.name: Create New Collection
step.text: Click Create collection and choose between Manual or Automated collection type.

step.name: Configure Collection Settings
step.text: Enter collection title, description, and set availability options.

step.name: Add Products to Collection
step.text: For manual collections, browse and select products. For automated collections, set conditions based on tags, price, or title.

step.name: Optimize and Save
step.text: Add SEO-optimized descriptions and save your collection settings.

mainEntity.name: What's the difference between manual and automated collections?

acceptedAnswer.text: Manual collections require you to add products manually, ideal for curated selections like featured or seasonal products. Automated collections use rules and conditions to automatically update based on product attributes like tags, price, or title.

mainEntity.name: Can a product belong to multiple collections?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, a product can belong to multiple collections, which helps increase product visibility across your store. You can add products to collections like Best Sellers, New Arrivals, or Seasonal Collections simultaneously.

mainEntity.name: How do product tags help with collection organization?

acceptedAnswer.text: Product tags allow you to automatically add products to automated collections based on specific conditions. Tags like 'new', 'sale', or 'featured' help organize collections and improve customer navigation.

mainEntity.name: What are the best practices for collection SEO?

acceptedAnswer.text: Use clear, descriptive collection names that match search queries, include detailed keyword-optimized descriptions, and use strategic product tags. Optimize collection pages with relevant keywords and meta descriptions.
